A Prayer<S>8605</S> of David<S>1732</S>. Bow down<S>5186</S> thine ear<S>241</S>, O LORD<S>3068</S>, hear<S>6030</S> me: for I am poor<S>6041</S> and needy<S>34</S>. <sup>A Prayer: or, A Prayer, being a Psalm of David</sup>
Preserve<S>8104</S> my soul<S>5315</S>; for I am holy<S>2623</S>: O thou my God<S>430</S>, save<S>3467</S> thy servant<S>5650</S> that trusteth<S>982</S> in thee. <sup>holy: or, one whom thou favourest</sup>
Be merciful<S>2603</S> unto me, O Lord<S>136</S>: for I cry<S>7121</S> unto thee daily<S>3117</S>. <sup>daily: or, all the day</sup>
Rejoice<S>8055</S> the soul<S>5315</S> of thy servant<S>5650</S>: for unto thee, O Lord<S>136</S>, do I lift up<S>5375</S> my soul<S>5315</S>.
For thou, Lord<S>136</S>, art good<S>2896</S>, and ready to forgive<S>5546</S>; and plenteous<S>7227</S> in mercy<S>2617</S> unto all them that call<S>7121</S> upon thee.
Give ear<S>238</S>, O LORD<S>3068</S>, unto my prayer<S>8605</S>; and attend<S>7181</S> to the voice<S>6963</S> of my supplications<S>8469</S>.
In the day<S>3117</S> of my trouble<S>6869</S> I will call<S>7121</S> upon thee: for thou wilt answer<S>6030</S> me.
Among the gods<S>430</S> there is none like unto thee, O Lord<S>136</S>; neither are there any works like unto thy works<S>4639</S>.
All nations<S>1471</S> whom thou hast made<S>6213</S> shall come<S>935</S> and worship<S>7812</S> before<S>6440</S> thee, O Lord<S>136</S>; and shall glorify<S>3513</S> thy name<S>8034</S>.
For thou art great<S>1419</S>, and doest<S>6213</S> wondrous things<S>6381</S>: thou art God<S>430</S> alone.
Teach<S>3384</S> me thy way<S>1870</S>, O LORD<S>3068</S>; I will walk<S>1980</S> in thy truth<S>571</S>: unite<S>3161</S> my heart<S>3824</S> to fear<S>3372</S> thy name<S>8034</S>.
I will praise<S>3034</S> thee, O Lord<S>136</S> my God<S>430</S>, with all my heart<S>3824</S>: and I will glorify<S>3513</S> thy name<S>8034</S> for evermore<S>5769</S>.
For great<S>1419</S> is thy mercy<S>2617</S> toward me: and thou hast delivered<S>5337</S> my soul<S>5315</S> from the lowest<S>8482</S> hell<S>7585</S>. <sup>hell: or, grave</sup>
O God<S>430</S>, the proud<S>2086</S> are risen<S>6965</S> against me, and the assemblies<S>5712</S> of violent<S>6184</S> men have sought<S>1245</S> after my soul<S>5315</S>; and have not set<S>7760</S> thee before them. <sup>violent: Heb. terrible</sup>
But thou, O Lord<S>136</S>, art a God<S>410</S> full of compassion<S>7349</S>, and gracious<S>2587</S>, longsuffering<S>750</S> <S>639</S>, and plenteous<S>7227</S> in mercy<S>2617</S> and truth<S>571</S>.
O turn<S>6437</S> unto me, and have mercy<S>2603</S> upon me; give<S>5414</S> thy strength<S>5797</S> unto thy servant<S>5650</S>, and save<S>3467</S> the son<S>1121</S> of thine handmaid<S>519</S>.
Shew<S>6213</S> me a token<S>226</S> for good<S>2896</S>; that they which hate<S>8130</S> me may see<S>7200</S> it, and be ashamed<S>954</S>: because thou, LORD<S>3068</S>, hast holpen<S>5826</S> me, and comforted<S>5162</S> me.
